DisallowArrayconstructors

Use of theArrayconstructor to construct a new array is generally
discouraged in favor of array literal notation because of the single-argument
pitfall and because theArrayglobal may be redefined. The exception is when
theArrayconstructor is used to intentionally create sparse arrays of a
specified size by giving the constructor a single numeric argument.
